title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the maximum change in the money supply as a decrease of $500,000 and/or does not show the work.

Change in MS=Bond Sale×Money Multiplier=−$100,000× 1 0.2 =−$500,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7031@

The response calculates the maximum change in the money supply as a decrease of $500,000 and shows the work.

Change in MS=Bond Sale×Money Multiplier=−$100,000× 1 0.2 =−$500,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7031@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that nominal gross domestic product will decrease and/or does not explain that according to the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BDB@ , a decrease in the money supply will decrease nominal gross domestic product for a given velocity.

The response states that nominal gross domestic product will decrease and explains that according to the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BDB@ , a decrease in the money supply will decrease nominal gross domestic product for a given velocity.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the price level decreases.
The response states that the price level decreases.
